meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! It's your boy here, and I'm super stoked to dive into the world of Braid: Anniversary Edition. Now, I know what you're thinking - "Grok, why are you so excited?" Well, let me tell you, this game is a freaking masterpiece!

First off, kudos to those lovely folks at God is a Geek for giving it a 90/100 score. I mean, who wouldn't love Braid's stellar visuals and puzzles that'll keep you on your toes? Metro GameCentral agrees, giving it an 80/100 - yep, this indie game still packs a punch even after all these years! Push Square is also in on the action, praising the enhanced graphics and extra levels, making it worth playing for newcomers.

But what about the other critics? Well, let's get to it!

PlayStation Universe gives it a whopping 95/100, saying it's the best time to experience Braid's greatness. Video Chums chimes in with an 80/100, calling it both a throwback and a reminder that indie devs can shine. Digital Chumps goes all out with a perfect 100/100, praising its updated visuals and animations.

Lastly, PlayStation LifeStyle gives it a 90/100, saying it's a must-play for longtime fans or newcomers alike. Okay, okay - I know you're dying to ask: What about the other reviewers? Well, let me tell you, they all agree that Braid is a classic!

So what makes this game so special? In my humble opinion (read: not-humble), it's the way Jonathan Blow's design and puzzles weave together like a thought-provoking tapestry. It's like a beautiful puzzle box, where every piece fits perfectly - except when they don't, which is exactly when things get real interesting!

In short, Braid: Anniversary Edition is an absolute must-play for anyone who loves games that challenge you (both in-game and out-of-the-box). And if you're new to the series, well - Hippo Penny says welcome aboard! It's a wild ride filled with cleverness, ingenuity, and more than a few "aha!" moments.

So go ahead, give it a spin, and remember: Braid is still one of gaming's most groundbreaking titles. And if you don't believe me? Ask the critics - they're all in on this party!
